column1: Stock was a town in the north of the Marish
column2: lying on the Stock-brook stream near to the banks of the River Brandywine and south of the Brandywine Bridge in the Eastfarthing of the Shire. Stock was the meeting point of the Causeway
column4: and a road that led to Tuckborough to the west. The Golden Perch in Stock was said to have the finest beer in the Eastfarthing.

column1: During Frodo Baggins journey to Buckland
column2: Frodo announced that he wished to straight across country to the Bucklebury Ferry.  Peregrin Took objected to the short cut
column3: and mentioned the Golden Perch.  The hobbits avoided Stock in order to keep Pippin away from there and prevent their journey from being delayed.

column1: The name possibly represents a modernization of Old English Stoc "place
2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game):
:In the Game Boy Advance version of The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)
column2: it is possible to visit both Stock and the Golden Perch.
towns and villages of the Shire
